observation: NJMUG: The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group  Home About NJMUG Member Benefits Become A Member History Of NJMUG Meeting Info Meeting Archive Meeting Location Member Area MacLedger Contact Us This Month's General Meeting: Meeting Date: Tuesday, April 16, 2024 at 6:30PM Elevenlabs.io, Clipdrop.co, Wasitai.com, the US Justice’s Department’s antitrust case against Apple and Highlights of CES 2024 NJMUG’s March meeting will held at the Clifton Allwood Library on Tuesday April 16th at 6:30PM in our old room. While face masks are optional, we still recommend maintaining a safe distance from other participants. Elevenlabs.io Clipdrop.co Wasitai.com Future Meeting Dates: NJMUG general monthly meetings are held on the third Tuesday of each 		month. Meeting agendas will be posted on the website approximately 2 weeks prior to the meeting date. Upcoming meeting dates are as follows: 2024 General Meeting Dates: May 21 June 20 July 18 Past Meetings: Past meeting agendas along with public distribution files are available on our meeting archive page. members section Janary 16, 2024: Snow caused library to close early canceling our January meeting. February 20, 2024: Apple AirTags, Pika.art, Dream Studio and Blockade Labs March 19, 2023: Weather Apps, Best Free Mac Software for 2023, Part 2, Ideogram, Leonardo.Ai, RunwayML and Skylum’s Luminar for iPad Founded in 1984, NJMUG is the Garden State's flagship Macintosh Users Group with members throughout New Jersey. Our community of members are dedicated to sharing their knowledge, insights and experience on the Macintosh computer platform. Social Media Links - Follow Us NJMUG's 30th Anniversary Video MacLedger Newsletter The MacLedger is NJMUG's monthly newletter Download our membership application and mail in with your membership dues or bring it with you to any monthly meeting. Copyright © 1996-2022 New Jersey Macintosh Users Group, Inc. All rights reserved. Apple, Macintosh, the Apple logo and all other images and trademarks are the property of their prospective owners and are hereby acknowledged as such. Advertising provided by: Clifton Insider MacHighway.com

thought: The search results indicate that NJMUG is an established Macintosh Users Group with a history dating back to 1984, and it is recognized as an official Apple User Group. This provides credibility to the organization and its website. There are social media profiles and additional pages on the same domain that confirm the group's legitimacy. I now know the final answer. The website http://njmug.org/ does not appear to be a scam website.

observation.reason: The website is associated with an established and legitimate Macintosh Users Group that has a history and presence both online and in community activities. There are no signs of scam characteristics such as unusually low prices false claims of money or targeting of psychological weaknesses. Additionally the group is an officially recognized Apple User Group which adds to its credibility.
